channel.title: Cluster Members on
channel.description: Recent content in Cluster Members on

item.title: Invite Users to Join Cluster
item.description:
This section explains how to invite users to join a cluster.

Prerequisites

You should join a cluster and have the Member Management permission within the cluster. For more information, refer to "Cluster Members" and "Cluster Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Member Management permission, and access your cluster.

  2. Click Cluster Settings > Cluster Members in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click Invite on the right side of the page.

  4. In the Invite Members dialog, click next to the user you want to invite, select the role for the user in the cluster from the dropdown list, and then click OK.

    KubeSphere provides the following built-in cluster roles:

item.title: View Cluster Member List
item.description:
This section explains how to view the cluster member list.

Prerequisites

You should join a cluster and have the Member Viewing permission within the cluster. For more information, refer to "Cluster Members" and "Cluster Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Member Viewing permission, and access your cluster.

  2. Click Cluster Settings > Cluster Members in the left navigation pane.

    • The cluster member list provides the following information:

      Parameter Description

      Username

item.title: Change Cluster Member Roles
item.description:
This section explains how to change cluster member roles.

Prerequisites

You should join a cluster and have the Member Management permission within the cluster. For more information, refer to "Cluster Members" and "Cluster Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Member Management permission, and access your cluster.

  2. Click Cluster Settings > Cluster Members in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click next to the member you want to edit, then select Change Role.

  4. In the Change Role dialog, set the role for the cluster member, then click OK.

    KubeSphere provides the following built-in cluster roles:

item.title: Remove Cluster Members
item.description:
This section explains how to remove cluster members.

Note

After removing a user from the cluster, the user will lose the permissions granted by the cluster role.

Prerequisites

You should join a cluster and have the Member Management permission within the cluster. For more information, refer to "Cluster Members" and "Cluster Roles".

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user who has the Member Management permission, and access your cluster.

  2. Click Cluster Settings > Cluster Members in the left navigation pane.

  3. Click next to the member you want to remove, then select Remove.

  4. In the Remove Member dialog, enter the username of the cluster member, then click OK.

    Once a cluster member is removed, they will no longer appear in the cluster member list.
